turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about İzmir.
turn.1: When did the name  ⁇ zmir come to be used?
turn.2: Izmir" (sometimes "İzmir") was adopted in English and most foreign languages after Turkey adopted the Latin alphabet in 1928 and urged other countries to use the city's Turkish name.
turn.3: What city in Turkey is named Izmir?
turn.4: The city is one of the oldest settlements of the Mediterranean basin.
turn.5: What archeological evidence is there of the city's early history?
turn.6: The 2004 discovery of Yeşilova Höyük and the neighboring Yassıtepe, in the small delta of Meles River, now the Bornova plain, reset the starting date of the city's past further back than previously thought.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Findings from two seasons of excavations carried out in the Yeşilova Höyük by a team of archaeologists from İzmir's Ege University indicate three levels, two of which are prehistoric.
turn.9: What did these findings tell us about the city's early history?
turn.10: Level 2 bears traces of early to mid-Chalcolithic, and Level 3 of Neolithic settlements.
turn.12: These two levels would have been inhabited by the indigenous peoples of the area, very roughly, between 7th millennium BC to 4th millennium BC.
